member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache
member.summary: Deletes an existing globe service cache and all tiles in it.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)
The name of the globe service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)
The layers in the globe service whose caches will be deleted. All layers of the service are included by default. If a layer is excluded the layer's cache will not be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.object_name
member.summary: The name of the globe service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.Layer
member.summary: The layers in the globe service whose caches will be deleted. All layers of the service are included by default. If a layer is excluded the layer's cache will not be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache
member.summary: Deletes an existing map service cache, including all associated files on disk.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)
The map service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)
The source data frame of the cache to be deleted. This appears in the user interface for informational purposes only and cannot be changed. (In, Required)
The layers to delete from the cache (only applies to multilayer caches). Layers that are included will be removed from the cache. Excluded layers will remain. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.object_name
member.summary: The map service whose cache will be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.data_frame
member.summary: The source data frame of the cache to be deleted. This appears in the user interface for informational purposes only and cannot be changed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.Layer
member.summary: The layers to delete from the cache (only applies to multilayer caches). Layers that are included will be removed from the cache. Excluded layers will remain. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.out_server_name
member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.out_object_name
member.summary: Output Map Server (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteMapServerCache.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme
member.summary: Generates an XML tiling scheme file that defines the scale levels, tile dimensions, and other properties for a map service cache. This tool is useful when creating a tiling scheme to use in multiple caches. You can load the tiling scheme file when you create a cache in ArcCatalog or Manager, or you can run Create Map Server Cache and pass in the tiling scheme file as a parameter.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The source map document to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)
The data frame to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)
The upper left corner of the tiling scheme in coordinates of the spatial reference of the source data frame. (In, Required)
Path and file name of the tiling scheme file to create. (Out, Required)
Number of scale levels in the tiling scheme. (In, Required)
Scale levels to include in the tiling scheme. These are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, and so on. (In, Required)

The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)
The width of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)
The height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.map_document
member.summary: The source map document to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.data_frame
member.summary: The data frame to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.tile_origin
member.summary: The upper left corner of the tiling scheme in coordinates of the spatial reference of the source data frame. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.tiling_schema
member.summary: Path and file name of the tiling scheme file to create. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.cache_levels
member.summary: Number of scale levels in the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.levels
member.summary: Scale levels to include in the tiling scheme. These are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, and so on. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.dpi
member.summary: The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.tile_width
member.summary: The width of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.tile_height
member.summary: The height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache
member.summary: Creates the tiling scheme and preparatory folders for a map service cache. After running this tool, run Manage Map Server Cache Tiles to add tiles to the cache.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service to be cached. (In, Required)
The map service to be cached. (In, Required)
The map data frame to be cached. (In, Required)
The parent directory for the cache. This must be a registered ArcGIS Server cache directory. (In, Required)

Choose to use a NEW or PREDEFINED tiling scheme. You can define a new tiling scheme with this tool or browse to a predefined tiling scheme file (.xml). A predefined scheme can be created by running the Generate Map Server Cache Tiling Scheme tool. (In, Required)
Specify how you will define the scales for the tiles. (In, Required)
The number of scale levels to create in the cache. This option is disabled if you create a custom list of scales. (In, Required)

The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)
The width of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)
The height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service to be cached. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.object_name
member.summary: The map service to be cached. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.data_frame
member.summary: The map data frame to be cached. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.out_folder
member.summary: The parent directory for the cache. This must be a registered ArcGIS Server cache directory. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tiling_scheme_type
member.summary: Choose to use a NEW or PREDEFINED tiling scheme. You can define a new tiling scheme with this tool or browse to a predefined tiling scheme file (.xml). A predefined scheme can be created by running the Generate Map Server Cache Tiling Scheme tool. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.scales_type
member.summary: Specify how you will define the scales for the tiles. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.num_of_scales
member.summary: The number of scale levels to create in the cache. This option is disabled if you create a custom list of scales. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.dpi
member.summary: The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_width
member.summary: The width of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_height
member.summary: The height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 or 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.map_or_layers
member.summary: Choose to generate a FUSED or MULTI_LAYER cache: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tiling_schema
member.summary: Path to a predefined tiling scheme file (usually named conf.xml). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_origin
member.summary: The origin (upper left corner) of the tiling scheme in the coordinates of the spatial reference of the source map document. The extent of the source map document must be within (but does not need to coincide) with this region. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.levels
member.summary: Scale levels available for the cache. These are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, and so on. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.Layer
member.summary: Layers to include in the cache if MULTI_LAYER cache type is chosen. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.Antialiasing
member.summary: Specifies whether to use antialiasing when rendering the tiles. If antialiasing is chosen, edges of lines, borders, and text will be smoothed. There is a performance cost for this option. The performance cost is greater when using MXD-based map services (as opposed to MSD-based map services that have antialiasing defined in the MSD file). Antialiasing provides no benefit with raster imagery. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.cache_format
member.summary: Choose either PNG8, PNG24, PNG32, JPEG, or MIXED file format for the tiles in the cache. PNG8 is the default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_compression_quality
member.summary: Enter a value between 1 and 100 for the JPEG compression quality. The default value is 75 for JPEG tile format and zero for other formats. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.storage_format
member.summary: Choose whether to group your tiles into large .bundle files using "Compact" storage format, instead of storing each tile as a separate file using "Exploded" format. Compact storage format is more efficient in terms of storage and mobility. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.use_local_cache_dir
member.summary: Choose whether bundle files should be written into a local directory on the server when creating a compact cache, instead of being written directly into the shared cache directory. If you choose this option, the bundle files will be copied into the shared cache directory as they are completed. This option improves performance when multiple machines are working on the caching job. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.out_server_name
member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.out_object_name
member.summary: Output Map Server (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.summary: Updates the scale levels in an existing cached map service. Use this tool to add new scales or delete existing scales from a map cache.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The name of the map service from which you want to remove cache scales. (In, Required)
The scale values to be included in the updated tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service from which you want to remove cache scales. (In, Required)

member.summary: The name of the map service from which you want to remove cache scales. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheScales.levels
member.summary: The scale values to be included in the updated tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles
member.summary: Creates and updates tiles in an existing map service cache. This tool is used to create new tiles, replace missing tiles, overwrite outdated tiles, and delete tiles.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the map service whose tiles you want to update. (In, Required)
The map service whose cache tiles you want to update. (In, Required)
The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)
Layers to remove from the cache. (In, Required)
The scale levels at which you will create or delete tiles when running this tool, depending on the Update Mode. (In, Required)
Choose a mode for updating the cache. The three modes are: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the map service whose tiles you want to update. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.object_name
member.summary: The map service whose cache tiles you want to update. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.data_frame
member.summary: The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.Layer
member.summary: Layers to remove from the cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.levels
member.summary: The scale levels at which you will create or delete tiles when running this tool, depending on the Update Mode. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.update_mode
member.summary: Choose a mode for updating the cache. The three modes are: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.constraining_extent
member.summary: Rectangular extent at which to create or delete tiles, depending on the Update Mode. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.thread_count
member.summary: Number of map service instances to use while running this tool. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2). If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances in the service's Service Properties dialog box, then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.Antialiasing
member.summary: This is a deprecated parameter that is ignored. The antialiasing property in your tiling scheme determines if antialiasing is applied to the cache. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.update_feature_class
member.summary: You can use a polygon feature class to manage tiles (create, update, or delete) based on the extents of features of a feature class. For example, if you are caching a country, you might supply a feature class of major urban areas. By doing so, you are requesting that the server only pre-create tiles that cover those urban areas. The rest of the areas can be cached on demand when requested by clients. This can save you time and disk space that would be consumed by creating unneeded tiles in rural areas. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.ignore_status
member.summary: This parameter allows you to track the status of your caching if you are creating tiles based on feature class boundaries (see the update_feature_class parameter). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.out_server_name
member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.out_object_name
member.summary: Output Map Server (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles
member.summary: Creates and updates tiles in an existing globe service cache. This tool is used to create new tiles or to replace missing tiles, overwrite outdated tiles, or add new tiles. All these actions can be defined by rectangular extents or by a polygon feature class. When creating new tiles, you can choose whether to create only empty tiles or re-create all tiles.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the globe service whose tiles you are managing. (In, Required)
The globe service whose tiles will be modified. (In, Required)
Select the layers to include in the cache. (In, Required)
Choose a mode for updating the cache. The two modes are: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the globe service whose tiles you are managing. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.object_name
member.summary: The globe service whose tiles will be modified. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.in_layers
member.summary: Select the layers to include in the cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.update_mode
member.summary: Choose a mode for updating the cache. The two modes are: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.update_extent
member.summary: Rectangular extent at which tiles should be created or deleted, depending on the Update Mode. You can type the extent values or choose an extent from an existing data source. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.thread_count
member.summary: Number of globe service instances to use while running this tool. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2) . If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances in the Service Properties, then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.update_feature_class
member.summary: You can use a polygon feature class to manage tiles (create/update) based on the extents of features in a feature class. For example, if you are caching a country, you might supply a feature class of major urban areas. By doing so, you are requesting that the server only pre-create tiles that cover those urban areas. The rest of the areas can be cached on demand when requested by clients. This can save you time and disk space that would be consumed by creating unneeded tiles in rural areas. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ignore_status
member.summary: This parameter allows you to track the status of your caching if you are creating tiles based on feature class boundaries (see the update_feature_class parameter). (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat
member.summary: Converts the storage of a map service cache between the exploded (pre-10.0) format and the compact format. The tool converts the format "in place", meaning it does not make a copy of the existing format. Instead, it creates the new format cache in the same cache folder and deletes the old format.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache format will be changed. (In, Required)
The map service whose cache format will be changed. (In, Required)
The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache format will be changed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.object_name
member.summary: The map service whose cache format will be changed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.data_frame
member.summary: The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.storage_format_type
member.summary: The storage format to which the new cache will be converted. The tool user interface detects your current cache format and lists the other format as the only option for this parameter. The formats are EXPLODED and COMPACT. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.thread_count
member.summary: Number of map service instances to use while converting the cache. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2) . If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances (accessible from the Service Properties dialog box in ArcCatalog, the Catalog window, or Manager), then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.out_server_name
member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.out_object_name
member.summary: Output Map Server (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache
member.summary: Exports tiles from a map cache to a folder on disk. The tiles can either be imported into other caches or they can be accessed from ArcGIS Desktop as a raster dataset, independent from their parent service.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache tiles will be exported. (In, Required)
The map service whose tiles will be exported. (In, Required)
The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)
The folder into which the cache will be exported. This folder does not have to be a registered server cache directory. (In, Required)

Number of map service instances to use while exporting the cache. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2). If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances in the Service Properties, then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Required)
The storage format of the exported cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service whose cache tiles will be exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.object_name
member.summary: The map service whose tiles will be exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.data_frame
member.summary: The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.target_cache
member.summary: The folder into which the cache will be exported. This folder does not have to be a registered server cache directory. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.thread_count
member.summary: Number of map service instances to use while exporting the cache. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2). If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances in the Service Properties, then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.storage_format_type
member.summary: The storage format of the exported cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.export_extent
member.summary: A rectangular extent defining the tiles to be exported. By default the extent is set to the full extent of the service's source map. Note the optional parameter on this tool that allows you to alternatively constrain tile export to a feature class boundary. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.levels
member.summary: A list of scale levels at which tiles will be exported. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.export_feature_class
member.summary: A polygon feature class that defines where tiles are exported from the cache. This is useful if you want to export irregularly shaped areas. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.out_server_name
member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.out_object_name
member.summary: Output Map Server (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache
member.summary: Imports tiles from a folder on disk into a map cache. The source folder can be a child of a registered server cache directory or it can be some other folder into which tiles have been previously exported. The target map service must have the same tiling scheme and the storage format as the source map cache.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service into which tiles will be imported. (In, Required)
The name of the map service into which tiles will be imported. This map service must have a tiling scheme defined that matches the tiling scheme of the tiles being imported. (In, Required)
The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)

The path to the tiles that will be imported. This is represented by a raster dataset icon in the tool user interface. If you are scripting, it is the path to the cache folder matching the data frame name. You do not have to point this parameter at a registered server cache directory; in fact, most of the time you'll be pointing at a location on disk where tiles have been previously exported. (In, Required)

Number of map service instances to use while importing the cache. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2). If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances in the Service Properties, then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.server_name
member.summary: The ArcGIS Server machine hosting the service into which tiles will be imported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.object_name
member.summary: The name of the map service into which tiles will be imported. This map service must have a tiling scheme defined that matches the tiling scheme of the tiles being imported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.data_frame
member.summary: The source data frame for the map service. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.source_cache_dataset
member.summary: The path to the tiles that will be imported. This is represented by a raster dataset icon in the tool user interface. If you are scripting, it is the path to the cache folder matching the data frame name. You do not have to point this parameter at a registered server cache directory; in fact, most of the time you'll be pointing at a location on disk where tiles have been previously exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.thread_count
member.summary: Number of map service instances to use while importing the cache. By default the maximum allowable number of instances will be used (default for an ArcGIS Server service is 2). If you have more server power, you can raise the maximum allowable number of instances in the Service Properties, then raise this parameter when you run the tool. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.import_extent
member.summary: A rectangular extent defining the tiles to be imported. By default the extent is set to the full extent of the map service into which you are importing. Note the optional parameter on this tool that allows you to alternatively constrain tile import to a feature class boundary. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.levels
member.summary: A list of scale levels at which tiles will be imported. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.import_feature_class
member.summary: A polygon feature class that defines where tiles are imported into the cache. This is useful if you want to import tiles for irregularly shaped areas. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.out_server_name
member.summary: Output Host (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.out_object_name
member.summary: Output Map Server (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.
